@graph.caption: Red velvet cake topped with cherries on a white cake stand

@graph.name: Vegan Red Velvet Cake - Loving It Vegan
@graph.description: This vegan red velvet cake is rich, moist, vibrantly red and topped with a delicious lemon buttercream frosting and maraschino cherries.

@graph.name: Alison Andrews
@graph.description: Hi I'm Alison Andrews, I'm the voice and cook behind Loving It Vegan. I love making delicious vegan food and creating vegan versions of all your old favorites, so that you’ll never feel like you’re missing out. Find out more about me here.

@graph.name: Vegan Red Velvet Cake
@graph.description: This vegan red velvet cake is rich, moist, vibrantly red and topped with a delicious lemon buttercream frosting and maraschino cherries.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup Vegan Buttermilk ((240ml) 1 Tbsp Lemon Juice + Soy Milk up to the 1 cup (240ml) line)
1/2 cup Canola Oil ((120ml) or Vegetable Oil)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Spray two 8-inch cake pans (see notes*) with non-stick spray and line the bottoms with parchment paper. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Spray two 8-inch cake pans (see notes*) with non-stick spray and line the bottoms with parchment paper. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Sift the flour into a mixing bowl and add the sugar, baking soda, salt and cocoa powder.
recipeInstructions.name: Sift the flour into a mixing bowl and add the sugar, baking soda, salt and cocoa powder.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the vegan buttermilk add 1 Tbsp lemon juice to a measuring jug and then add soy milk up to the 1 cup (240ml) line. Leave to sit for a minute, it will curdle into buttermilk.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the vegan buttermilk add 1 Tbsp lemon juice to a measuring jug and then add soy milk up to the 1 cup (240ml) line. Leave to sit for a minute, it will curdle into buttermilk.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the buttermilk, vanilla, oil, vinegar and red gel food color into the mixing bowl and mix in.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the buttermilk, vanilla, oil, vinegar and red gel food color into the mixing bowl and mix in.

recipeInstructions.text: Use a hand whisk briefly to get rid of any large lumps.
recipeInstructions.name: Use a hand whisk briefly to get rid of any large lumps.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the cake batter evenly between the two prepared cake pans.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the cake batter evenly between the two prepared cake pans.

recipeInstructions.text: Place into the oven and bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Place into the oven and bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the cakes to a wire cooling rack and allow to cool completely before frosting.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the cakes to a wire cooling rack and allow to cool completely before frosting.

recipeInstructions.text: While the cakes are cooling, add the powdered sugar, vegan butter, lemon extract and 2 tablespoons lemon juice to an electric mixing bowl and starting at slow speed gradually increase speed until the frosting is thick and smooth. If needed add more lemon juice (see notes*).
recipeInstructions.name: While the cakes are cooling, add the powdered sugar, vegan butter, lemon extract and 2 tablespoons lemon juice to an electric mixing bowl and starting at slow speed gradually increase speed until the frosting is thick and smooth. If needed add more lemon juice (see notes*).

recipeInstructions.text: When the cakes are completely cooled, frost and decorate with cherries (optional).
recipeInstructions.name: When the cakes are completely cooled, frost and decorate with cherries (optional).
